title: I'm Bram DelfosA new internet futurist
description: As an Engineer and founder of a data analytics startup, I’ve spent the last years researching the future of my industry to be ahead of everyone else. I’ve been actively iterating my vision for the future of marketing (community building) and digital ownership (WEB3), and it didn’t come as a surprise that Facebook was doing the same. By changing their name to Meta, they are positioning themselves for the next phase of the internet; the Metaverse. Beside questions as what the Metaverse is and why we need/want it, there are more fundamental questions with respect to the ethics and principles with which we want to build this new internet. Do we allow centralized companies to become dictators of our digital worlds, or do we want to recreate and improve our democratic values in our digital lives? The Metaverse bundles many industries in its creation and will revolutionize/disrupt practically everything we know today. The most interesting aspect to me is the possibility to experiment with governance in the digital realm and find ways to improve decision making.

title: In a short time, I have been able to achieve excellence in all areas of development.
description: I provide cost-effective and high quality products to meet our Clients’ needs of timely delivery World Wide. I want to be local in a global world to be where our Customers need our services customers need our services.

subtitle: PORTFOLIO
title: FEATURED WORKS
description: In other words, the best marketing decision you can make is to have a product or business that fulfills a real and compelling need for a real and defined group of people — no matter how much tweaking and refining this takes.(c)

title: My Skills in Years
description: When the past gets its teeth into our daily life, it may get to grips with an astringent reality and adjust our timeline. By recognizing ourselves in the light of our history, we become aware of what we are.(c)

title: Bram Delfos
subtitle: WEB3 expert
description: I propose to implement a combination of quadratic voting and reputation-based voting. This will ensure good economic incentives and permissionless participation (relative to registered voting), and will make it very difficult for power to centralize.
